intro: Vepris letouzeyi, commonly known as the Madagascar wild laurier, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white flowers. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its fruit is a small, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed. Vepris letouzeyi is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and thrives in well-drained soils.
